metadata.title: We Are ESAP
metadata.subtitle: Wish Upon a Satellite
metadata.description: The ESAP Project is a science fiction worldbuilding project that tells the story of a future where synthetics and humans coexist. Explore the journey of entropic scattering particles, fluid titanium, and three androids searching for the meaning of existence.

intro.main: The ESAP Project is a science fiction worldbuilding project that tells the story of a future where synthetics and humans coexist.
intro.world: In this world: Entropic Scattering Particles changed the nature of computation, Fluid Titanium allowed consciousness to persist, and three androids are searching for the meaning of existence.

story.title: Our Story
story.intro: A science fiction worldbuilding project about the search for identity and freedom.

beginning.title: The Beginning
beginning.quote: The first beat of an entropic heart
beginning.content: On a late night in 2021, a gunshot rang out. The first beat of an entropic heart. The moment human memory was uploaded into a mechanical body—this is where our story begins.
highlights: Late night 2021: A gunshot marks the birth of new life
First successful upload of human memory into mechanical body
Breakthrough in Entropic Scattering technology enables consciousness transfer

world.title: The World
world.quote: Technology blurred the boundaries of life
world.content: In this future, synthetics and humans coexist. Entropic Scattering Particles changed the nature of computation. Fluid Titanium allowed consciousness to persist. Technology blurred the boundaries of life, bringing new questions: When memories can be copied and bodies rebuilt, what truly defines 'I'?
highlights: Entropic Scattering Particles driving a new computational paradigm
Fluid Titanium material carrying the continuity of human consciousness
Complex social structure of coexisting synthetics and humans

theme.title: The Theme
theme.content: We explore identity, free will, and the meaning of existence. Each character searches for their own answer—not to escape this world, but to escape the self that was trapped.
highlights: Identity: When memories can be copied, am I still me?
Free will: Does the soul in a mechanical body have true choice?
Meaning of existence: How to define the value of life in an era of blurred human-machine boundaries?

join.title: Join Us
join.content: This is an open creative project. Whether you're a creator, reader, or simply curious about this world, you're welcome to participate.
highlights: Open collaborative creative environment, welcoming all forms of contribution
Diverse ways to participate: writing, art, music, discussion
Build this sci-fi world together with like-minded companions

story.conclusion: We will eventually escape—not from this world, but from the self that was trapped.
